main event: A bright, round light was observed in the sky over Washington, D.C. for 10-15 minutes on August 10, 1956.
interesting points: The object appeared stationary and did not move during the entire observation period.
At one point, the object seemed to dim slightly but then regained its original brightness.
The object was observed by several people at the scene.
The object was clearly different from stars and planets in the sky at the time.
Further investigation was recommended to determine the exact nature of the observed object.
